captions.text: To Santa Claus, Poste Restante

Can I ask for the new DOG OF WAR game, you
think?
Okay!
Alright!

How many 'S's in Santa Claus?
Are there

twenty-six, or are
there forty-four?

It doesn't matter. Just be sure that you spell
whatever you're asking for correctly, Kid.

It has two 'S's. One at the
front, and one at the end.

I'm going to tell him I want
rocket boots for Christmas.

Kid! You're still too little to ask for rocket
boots this year... Isn't that right, Rosie?

Totally right, Dad. Even
I'm still to small to wear

rocket boots, so I'm asking
Santa for regular ones.
How about... an invisibility cloak?

But I don't get to see you
enough as it is, my little

angel-monkey! I'd miss you too
much if you were invisible!

Fair point. Guess I'll go
back to the drawing board.
What should I ask for for Christmas?

There's... a flying carpet...
or a tap-dancing robot...

You've got to take it easier on Mom
and Day, you know, Kid... Don't ask

for impossible presents. Wouldn't
you like to have your own trike?
I would!
Then ask for a tricycle for Christmas.

But isn't Santa supposed to
give us whatever we ask for?

It's time for you to grow up a little bit, Kid.
Because there's no

such thing as Santa Claus. All of
the presents come from our parents.
It's not true!

Look, I used to believe
in Santa Claus, too, Kid.

And that he actually read my letters.
But then

one night I had the most amazing dream... I asked
Santa for the snowglobe I saw in the dream.

So I gave the letter to Mommy. And
then... when I opened my present...

It was just a plain old snowglobe.
It wasn't my dream snowglobe.

I still dream about that
special snowglobe sometimes.

But, I've also learned. The
fact is that special snowglobe

just doesn't exist. Which makes
it an impossible present.

Get the point? You can't ask for something
too hard. Give Mom and Dad a break...
Santa Claus exists.

No, he doesn't. But don't take my word for it.
Ask him for something but don't tell

Mom and Dad what. And you'll see. You
won't get what you asked for. You won't!

Kid... have you decided what
you're asking Santa for yet?

I have! I wrote him about it in a letter.
And sent it.
How'd you send it?
Just like this!

If Santa is really out there,
I know he'll get my letter.
What did you ask him for?
It's secret!

Mommy told me... you've already
sent your letter to Santa Claus.
Uh-huh!

Well, that's great! Are you sure that
you got everything spelled right? Why

don't you just write him again? I'll
read through it. And fix your mistakes.

No thanks. This whole past
year, ... I've been really good.

So, even if I misspelled it,
I'll get what I asked him for.
He won't tell us. What do we do?!

I don't know... Kid just sincerely believes in
Santa Claus. I don't want to crush his dreams.

Tricycle! It's a tricycle... That's what he wants.
But you have to promise not to

tell him I told you. I want him to believe
in Santa Claus as long as he can.
So beautiful! Presents!
My microscope!

Tug my leash!! It's DOG OF
WAR... Collector's Edition!!
You're just beautiful!

You got the exact ones that I've been dying to
get! Thanks so much, Mom and Dad, I mean Santa!
Mom, Dad, I love it!
Well then you should thank Santa Claus.

But I didn't ask Santa Claus for a tricycle.
I asked Santa for a present for Liza.
You did what?
Just like my dream! My snowglobe!!
Santa's real and this proves it!

title: Барбоскины - 123 серия. Деду морозу до востребования (новые серии)
